New Records: Celtics match NBA-record 29 3-pointers in a win vs. Knicks
Key Match Events: Tatum scored 37 points and made eight of the Celtics' NBA record-tying 29 3-pointers
Boston led by as many as 35 points before missing its last 13 3-point attempts
The TD Garden crowd’s attention strayed from the basketball game and it began chanting ‘Yankees Suck!’
Pre-Game Insights: The Celtics raised their NBA-most 18th championship banner to the rafters before the game
The new-look Knicks were supposed to be the biggest threat to the Celtics in the Eastern Conference
Post-Match Reflections: The new-look Knicks were no match for the team that finished 14 games in front last season
On July 28, U.S. Olympic basketball coach Steve Kerr benched Tatum for a game against Serbia, guaranteeing Tatum would be motivated for the Celtics’ title defense
Miscellaneous Highlights: With the Celtics leading by more than 20 points early in the third quarter, the TD Garden crowd’s attention strayed from the basketball game and it began chanting ‘Yankees Suck!’
The crowd chanted ‘One more 3!’ in the final minutes
